definition: one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/lack of sticking power/short attention span
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to air/to sun
ten/10
cold/poor/to tremble

sentences.english: Reading is not the night five drum, is work by fits and starts.
sentences.chinese: 读不在三更五鼓，功只怕一曝十寒。

sentences.english: Spasmodic bouts of exercise are not very beneficial.
sentences.chinese: 一曝十寒的运动不会有多大好处。

definition: one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/short attention span
lit. to fish for three days and sun-dry the nets for two days (proverb)/fig. not to persevere in doing sth/to do sth by fits and starts
pinyin: san1 tian1 da3 yu2 , liang3 tian1 shai4 wang3

definition: to pursue unremittingly (idiom); to persevere
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
see 磨杵成針|磨杵成针[mo2 chu3 cheng2 zhen1]
in two minds about sth (idiom)/half-hearted/shilly-shallying
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
lit. the scholar buys a donkey (idiom); fig. long-winded verbiage that never gets to the point/idiom mocking scholastic pomposity
to start but not finish (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span
study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
not paying attention to anything (idiom); to idle time away
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
